b924ee1d670b08a5.description:
Advert
Assistant Recruitment Events Officer

To provide comprehensive and professional support to the Student Recruitment Events Team and wider Student Recruitment Team. To assist with planning, organising and delivering a range of key recruitment events and activities aimed at prospective students, both on campus and virtually. In addition, the post holder will be required to represent the University at external recruitment events, which will require travel across the UK and overnight stays.

This is a full-time (35 hours per week), open-ended position.

Salary: £22,847 - £27,116 per annum (Grade 4)

Date advert posted: Thursday, 27 January 2022

Closing date: Wednesday, 23 March 2022

Please be aware that Cardiff University reserves the right to close this vacancy early should sufficient applications be received.

Cardiff University is committed to supporting and promoting equality and diversity and to creating an inclusive working environment. We believe this can be achieved through attracting, developing, and retaining a diverse range of staff from many different backgrounds who have the ambition to create a University which seeks to fulfil our social, cultural and economic obligation to Cardiff, Wales, and the world. In supporting our employees to achieve a balance between their work and their personal lives, we will also consider proposals for flexible working or job share arrangements.
Job Description
PLEASE ENSURE THAT YOU READ THE TEXT RELATING TO THE COMPLETION OF A SUPPORTING STATEMENT DETAILED WITHIN THE PERSON SPECIFICATION SECTION

Key Duties
Undertake a variety of duties to support the Recruitment Events Team in the development, organisation and delivery of both on-campus and virtual recruitment events, including large-scale open days. Provide administrative support to these events and wider department projects, where required.
Establish excellent working relationships and communication links with key stakeholders, both internally and externally, to help improve service levels and to facilitate the smooth running of student recruitment events and services.
Collaborate with others to make recommendations for the development of established processes and procedures.
Develop a sound knowledge of virtual event platforms (such as Zoom, Teams and Unibuddy).
Monitor market intelligence and competitor activity. Gather, analyse and interpret data to inform decisions, establishing basic trends and patterns in data, and creating reports as appropriate.
When called upon, provide detailed information, advice and guidance on a range of undergraduate recruitment issues, to both internal and external stakeholders, using judgement to suggest the most appropriate course of action. This may include supporting colleagues across the University in relation to student recruitment/ event management, or providing prospective students with information on degree programmes, entry requirements, the UCAS process and funding.
Represent the University online and in person at events on campus and at schools, colleges and higher education exhibitions across the UK. This element of the work will involve travel throughout the UK, including overnight stays and out-of-hours working.
Contribute to the development and delivery of presentations/workshops for use in schools and colleges, in addition to events on campus.
Supervise casual student support (unistaff) used in recruitment operations, including office administrative tasks, open day events and campus tours.
General Duties
Ensure that an understanding of the importance of confidentiality is applied when undertaking all duties.
Abide by University policies on Health and Safety and Equality and Diversity.
Perform other duties which are not included above, but which will be consistent with the role.
Person Specification
Candidates should evidence that they meet ALL of the essential criteria as well as, where relevant, the desirable criteria. As part of the application process you will be asked to provide this evidence via a Supporting Statement.
Please ensure when attaching it to your application profile that you name it with the vacancy reference number, in this instance, 13398BR.

Essential Criteria

Qualifications and Education
1. NVQ 3/A-levels or equivalent.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience
2. Experience of working in an events/administrative role, with proficiency in using common Office IT packages (eg MS Office).
3. Understanding of the current issues within higher education.
4. A full, valid UK/ EU driving licence.

Customer Service, Communication and Team Working
5. Ability to communicate (both in writing and orally) specialist and complex information effectively and professionally to a range of people, with varying levels of understanding.
6. Proven ability to advise and influence key stakeholders.
7. Evidence of ability to explore customers’ needs and adapt the service accordingly, to ensure a quality service is delivered.

Planning, Analysis and Problem solving
8. Ability to set up standard office systems and procedures, to analyse existing processes and make improvements, as appropriate.
9. Evidence of ability to solve problems using initiative and creativity: to identify and propose practical solutions.
10. Evidence of ability to work as part of a team, whilst also being able to work unsupervised to deadlines (planning and setting priorities for own work), with high levels of attention to detail.

Desirable Criteria
Degree or equivalent.
Experience of working in virtual events and/ or project management.
Experience of working in a higher education environment.
Experience of working with young people.
Fluency in Welsh (both written and oral).
Additional Information
The role will require a flexible approach to working hours, including out-of-hours working and some weekend working.
The role requires both office working (McKenzie House, Newport Road, Cardiff) and working from home. It will also involve working at a storage facility in Maindy Road, approximately 1.5 miles away from McKenzie House, and some lone working. There will be an element of manual handling in terms of event set up/breakdown, as well as the preparation and distribution of materials for events and mailings.
As well as events on campus, the role will also involve travel around the UK, representing the University at a range of external events (this may include overnight stays). In addition, the successful candidate will participate in virtual events.

It will not normally be possible to take annual leave close to, or on, days when open days take place (circa 6 per annum), nor during the Confirmation and Clearing period during August.

A satisfactory Disclosure Barring Service (DBS) check will be required on appointment.

About the Department
The Communications and Marketing Department is responsible for the University’s reputation and branding as well as UK/International student recruitment operations. It covers six areas: communications, marketing, student recruitment, digital communications, international and public affairs.

Communications plays an important part in building and maintaining the reputation of the University through effective communication to the public and to external and internal stakeholders. It communicates the achievements and aspirations of the University through a variety of media and includes a film unit. The team represents the University on a corporate level. Digital Communications is responsible for the design, development and content of the external website and the intranet. Marketing is responsible for developing a strong brand identity for the University at the corporate level, with an emphasis on better visual branding and market research.
Student recruitment plays an important role in attracting the University's undergraduate and postgraduate students from throughout the UK and Internationally, working in partnership with the University’s colleges and academic schools to recruit higher calibre students. The team also manages the University’s widening participation programmes and the School’s Partnership Project.
The International Office drives the University’s international recruitment strategy and advises on all areas related to international recruitment and development.
Public affairs leads on stakeholder relationships locally, nationally and internationally.

We are looking for someone to work with the Firm’s Marketing Partner and provide support for the Marketing Department’s initiative. You will be an ambassador and advocate for the Butcher & Barlow brand and assist in encouraging full and appropriate adoption of the brand across the whole business.

You should have excellent attention to detail, with problem solving and creative thinking skills.

Knowledge of the legal sector is helpful but not essential, however practical experience in a marketing team or qualification in marketing, public relations, communications or business studies, for example an HND, CIM, or Degree is a must.

A cleaning driving license is required as is the use of a vehicle.

Supporting with the coordination of content for the Firm’s social media channels.
Providing assistance to maintain content on the website including updating biographies, uploading articles and ensuring practice area information is current and relevant. Liaising with Web agency.
Engaging with fee earner about content creation, Identify potential news, topics, and comment opportunities, proofing copy, liaising with SEO agency regarding posting on the website and distribution on social media.

Production of marketing materials into the Firm’s templates.

Various tasks in the Firm’s Client Relationship Management (CRM) system.
Booking photography sessions.
Encouraging other departments and offices to take part in promotional activity.
Liaising with external agencies when the Marketing Partner is unavailable.
Assisting with applying for awards and recognition generally, including Legal 500 submissions.
Assisting with organising events includes invitation preparation and distribution, mailing list and RSVP management, venue and logistics organisation, on-site working with other specialists in the teams as appropriate.
Being the first point of contact for marketing emails, internally and externally.
General office duties for the Marketing Partner as and when requested.
Be an ambassador and advocate for the Butcher & Barlow brand, applying the brand and visual identity consistently across all channels and activities. Assist in encouraging full and appropriate adoption of the brand across the whole business.

Wise is helping to build a new world – a world without borders. Built by and for people who live global lives, we are the fairest, easiest way to manage your money across borders.

Please note: this role can be located from any of our office locations.

About Crowe

Crowe is a leading national audit, tax, advisory and risk firm with global reach and local expertise. We are an independent member of Crowe Global, one of the top 10 accounting networks in the world, with access to more than 38,000 people in more than 145 countries and across 700+ offices globally.

We pride ourselves on looking after our people, whether you’re working in corporate tax, statutory audit or you’re a marketing or HR specialist, at Crowe we invest in our people to help them be the best they can be.

We understand that it is often the culture and values of a firm that are most important when looking for a new workplace, that’s why at Crowe our people-focused culture means we value new ideas and innovation, and welcome people who are committed to making a different by delivering excellent services to our people, clients and communities.

Job description

Looking to start your career in communications or progress in the professional services market?

We’re looking for an energetic, resourceful and self-motivated Communications Assistant with a keen eye for detail and a passion for communications and creativity.

Reporting to the National Communications Manager, you will work across national initiatives to implement creative content across all of our marketing communications channels, helping to drive awareness of the Crowe brand and its thought leaders through the press, social media and crowe.co.uk.

The ideal candidate will be extremely efficient and bring creativity and passion to the role. A confident self-starter, you will thrive in a busy environment as the role will offer lots of opportunity to get involved and make a difference. You will need to be enthusiastic, have excellent organisational skills and a willingness to jump in and help our fast growing and busy function wherever needed. Must be open to travel to London and across all national offices from time to time.

We are looking for someone with excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, and who works well as part of a close-knit team.

Responsibilities

Daily sourcing and posting on all social media channels including updating and maintaining the central social media content planner.
Support in the delivery of national and regional press releases and media engagement.
Support the teams with content creation filming/photography including research and planning.
Uploads and edits to Crowe website, supporting the Web team.
Help deliver webinars nationally across the firm when needed.
Assisting the production of weekly and monthly reports.
Participate in idea generation sessions.
Work collaboratively across the marketing and communications function and supporting a number of different departments to assist with any ad hoc project requests.
General administrative support.

Behaviours and skills
Team player who takes initiative and can handle fast paced environment.
Positive attitude and enthusiasm.
Flexible and adaptable to change.
A self-starter who is confident working by themselves and within a team.
Someone who loves working resourcefully in an ever-evolving environment.
Proactive and looking to make the role their own.
Highly organised.
Meticulous in the detail.
Willing to go the extra mile.

Qualifications/experience

Minimum of 1 year’s relevant experience within a communications, digital and/or administrative function.
Communications or digital related qualification (Desirable).
Experienced with LinkedIn, Twitter and Instagram (Essential).
Experienced with the full Microsoft Suite / Teams (Essential).
Experienced with Adobe Suite (Desirable).

Why choose Crowe?

Crowe is where talented people can realise their potential, are successful and enjoy what they do by making a positive difference to our clients, communities and each other.

Our vision is to be recognised as essential to the future success of our clients by helping them to answer tomorrow’s questions, and make smart decisions that have lasting value through the highest quality audit, tax, advisory and risk services.

We offer you an opportunity to continue your career and work for a firm that offers stability and knowledge. In addition you can work alongside experienced professionals who put the client at the heart of everything they do.

At Crowe, you will find the expertise, the resources and, above all, the commitment to help you build a satisfying and rewarding career. In return we can offer you continued career development, highly competitive salaries and flexible benefits. Plus an opportunity to work for a firm that truly values its people.

Proactive and responsive
Strong communication skills

Responsible to Media/Press Officer
Commitment Voluntary, Office-based

Background

The Muslim Council of Britain (MCB) is the UK’s largest and most diverse national Muslim umbrella

organisation with over 500 members including mosques, schools, charitable associations and professional

networks. Our mission is empowering Muslim communities to achieving a just, cohesive and successful

British society.


Role Purpose

MCB are looking for a Social Media volunteer for a short- or long-term placement (minimum 3 months) to

help drive our online campaigns with national and international visibility.


You will be responsible for delivering MCB's social media strategy, helping to establish and expand our

visibility and engagement online.


Working directly with the Media and Public Affairs teams, you will be responsible for creating relevant, real-
time content and helping to drive engagement. You will be there to support the Communications and

Media team by creating, scheduling, reviewing and co-ordinating all social media related activities with

both external and internal stakeholders.


Key Tasks and Responsibilities

Day to Day activities will include:
Writing engaging, inspiring and thought-provoking social media posts.
Creating graphics for social media and web use.
Writing social media posts and updates (on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn).
Scheduling and content uploading for social media, websites and blogs.
Researching social media strategy and industry trends to implement changes for potential growth.
Uploading approved social media images, posts and videos accordingly.
Researching and using relevant hashtags to find target audience, to engage and comment on their
content and send them messages to start to build rapport and a community.

Liking, commenting and messaging our target audience. * Report weekly to the Head of Media on the
social media engagement and follower growth.

Contribute to help grow a community across social media platforms.
Extend brand presence socially to help increase engagement and loyalty.
Look out for patterns and trends in consumer comments/enquiries and adjust comments accordingly.
Increase leads and enquiries on social media.
Research and contact influencers who can help to build brand awareness.

Person Specification:
We are looking for an enthusiastic self-starter with knowledge and expertise in social media
management and producing digital content. We are a small team but extremely passionate
The ideal candidate will have a passion for helping others and making a difference. New ideas are
welcome, and we operate in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere
Proven experience in a communications/social media
Excellent written and spoken English language
Keen eye for detail
Strong communication skills
Ability to exercise discretion and confidentiality with sensitive information
Able to cope with pressure and meet tight deadlines
Understanding of the issues that the MCB deals with and the potentials risks and impacts.
Good understanding of British Muslim communities and respect for its diverse traditions and ethnic
backgrounds

This is an ideal role for someone who wants to get on at the ground floor and help to shape MCB's online

presence. You will be working alongside an interesting and friendly team.


To apply:


Please send a CV and a short covering letter explaining your motivations to careers@mcb.org.uk
Applicants will be considered on a rolling basis; therefore, early applications are encouraged.
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

3d95f6da63e6a09b.title: Marketing Assistant
3d95f6da63e6a09b.description:
Blazing Griffin (“BG”) is looking for a dynamic and motivated individual to assume responsibility for branding and marketing. Reporting directly to the Group’s Managing Director, the Marketing Assistant will develop and implement the overall brand and marketing strategy for the BG Group, specific strategies for the Post-production and Production divisions as well as supporting the Games division. This position would be ideal for a recent graduate interested in the creative industries or a moderately-experienced marketing professional looking to move into the this area.
They will be the champion of BG’s brand and marketing message and assume ownership of the challenge of increasing of brand visibility and building audiences. This role will be a balance between strategy development and hands-on tactical implementation.
A strong interest in the creative industries is essential to the success of the role, although prior industry experience is not
This post is a full-time position, with scope for career progression as the company continues its growth trajectory. The successful candidate will have the option to work a hybrid working pattern, working remotely when practical while making regular visits to the Glasgow office for meetings and collaboration.
Primary Responsibilities:

Working with key stakeholders to develop, implement and maintain brand and marketing strategies and delivering them to agreed timescales and budgets.
Embedding themselves with the Pictures, Post-production and Games divisions to obtain an in-depth understanding of the businesses.
Working directly with staff to develop detailed and, at times, technical copy
Managing, where applicable, external PR resources and media agencies
Define social media strategies and content for the Group, Pictures and Post-production and oversee their execution.
Analyse social media data to ensure maximum engagement.
Spreading knowledge and best practice social media knowledge across the company.
Management of the BG website.
Working with Divisional Heads to bring our products to market.
Planning and managing external marketing events.
Evaluating and reporting on the effectiveness of all marketing activities.
Required Skills:


A degree in a related discipline or a CIM qualification.
A creative eye and excellent attention to detail.
First-rate understanding and experience of marketing channels: online communications, events, brand advertising, editorial, and social media, and experience in using these channels to grow an online audience.
Strong event management skills.
A strong communicator and relationship builder
Willingness to travel internationally
Excellent presentation skills, to all sizes of audience
Good graphic design and editing skills with a working knowledge of Photoshop.


Desired

Master’s degree in a Marketing discipline
Creative industries experience
Working knowledge of Wordpress and Wix.
Working knowledge of video editing software (e.g. Final Cut, Premiere, Avid or Resolve).


If this role isn’t quite right, but you would like us to have your CV on file, please send it to jobs@blazinggriffin.com.
Blazing Griffin strives to promote equal opportunities for all. We welcome applications regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief.

Job Title: Events Assistant

Location: Bristol, Birmingham or Leeds

Join a team that makes real changes

Bevan Brittan is a UK-Top 100 commercial law firm providing a comprehensive range of legal services from offices in Birmingham, Bristol, Leeds and London.
The firm advises businesses across construction, energy & resource management, higher education and financial services, complementing the firm's market leadership within housing, local government and health and social care.

We currently employ over 500 people, including 80 Partners, and our award-winning teams provide construction, commercial, corporate, property, regulatory, employment and litigation (commercial and clinical negligence) legal advice.

Bevan Brittan is named among 'The Times Best Law Firms 2022' and has recently either won or been shortlisted for a number of prestigious awards including 'Legal Firm of the Year' at the Bristol Life Awards 2021.

We are driven by our 4 values: Relationships, Results, Reputation and Responsible. These give us a sense of purpose and ensure we always work collaboratively with clients and colleagues, continually improve, make the right choices and act with integrity.

Bevan Brittan is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants from all backgrounds.

Learn from the best

Bevan Brittan has strong recognition in the independent legal directories - Chambers & Partners and The Legal 500. In both guides we are consistently ranked in the top tier for our practices across the UK, with multiple individuals recognised as leading lawyers.

"By far Bevan Brittan is the most flexible, pragmatic, skilled and reliable legal firm I have worked with."- Chambers UK, 2022

Rise to the Challenge

Supporting the Events Executive with all aspects of the administration and delivery of the Bevan Brittan events programme digitally and across our four office locations
Using our CMS to create web pages to promote the events programme, ensuring that the information is always current and correct
Sourcing external venues and developing relationships as well as supporting the Events Executive with the upkeep of current relationships
Managing service delivery issues or dealing with colleague queries about the venues hosting our external meeting rooms.
Management of the marketing database for use with event email campaigns both pre and post event ensuring data accuracy
Using Eventbrite to set up each event, manage registrations and communications with delegates
Manage the Events email inbox, therefore being the first point of contact for delegates
Using InDesign to create graphics, invitations, agendas and to edit marketing collateral for events
Promoting our events on appropriate social media platforms
Following processes and keeping databases and spreadsheets up to date
Proof reading materials for sense and grammatical accuracy
Working with internal teams to ensure that event collateral is produced and delivered to meet deadlines
Using our document management system to ensure all communication is accurately filed
Compiling reports and analysis
Where required, subject to workloads, support the Marketing team to manage and distribute non-event related eCommunications.

Find out how far you can go

Essential skill set requirements:

Calm under pressure
Good time management and a reliable approach to work
Can demonstrate tact and assertiveness in communications with internal and external stakeholders
Willing to work outside of normal office hours and locations when required for event delivery; this will include some overnight stays
Eager to improve our events offering by working with the Events Executive to suggest and implement new ideas
A proactive individual who works well as part of a team

Preferred skill set requirements:

Experience of any of the following systems is beneficial but training will be provided - InDesign, Hoot suite, Survey Monkey, Eventbrite, Zoom
Experience of the Microsoft Suite is essential - to include Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent attention to detail
Able to demonstrate experience of organisational skills, preferably within a professional services environment
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

Work-life Balance
We offer a substantial benefits package to all employees, which includes 25 days holiday (plus the option to buy up to an additional 5 days), a generous pension scheme and private medical insurance through Vitality (including "phone a GP service", discounted gym membership and 'Vitality' Partner discounts).

All of our people are entitled to a biannual private health assessment through Nuffield Health and are included in the group life assurance scheme. We also have an Employee Assistance Programme (free telephone support and counselling service) and a cycle scheme (Save Tax & NI on a bike for cycling to work).

Where possible, we want to offer all Bevan Brittan people flexibility to work their week in a way that suits them - we operate a hybrid working model based on the needs of our clients, teams and that of the individual. Our core business hours are 9am - 5:15pm Monday to Friday, however we are open to individuals working more flexibly around those times and would welcome a conversation with you if you have any questions.

Responsible Business

To us, being a responsible business is second nature; a core part of Bevan Brittan's identity, running through our culture and embodied by the clients we serve.
Bevan Brittan seeks to play an active role within its local office communities. Through regular fundraising events, support for local initiatives and annual charity donations at Christmas, we have established a culture of giving within the firm. In December 2021 we donated a total of £60,000 to our four regional office charities, with each charity receiving £15,000 to help fund their vital services.

Our current selected charities in Bristol, Birmingham and Leeds are Great Western Air Ambulance, InUnity and Maggie's Cancer Care.

We want to demonstrate our commitment to these causes through actions rather than words; colleagues from across the firm are already heavily involved, living and breathing the four pillars of our Responsible Business strategy:

Community Engagement
Environmental Sustainability
Equality, Diversity & Inclusion
Wellbeing

Collectively, these four pillars ensure we look after our colleagues' wellbeing; offer an environment in which all can progress on merit, regardless of personal circumstances or background; give something back to the communities in which we work; and protect the environment.

Bevan Brittan is proudly a carbon neutral firm. We have achieved the UN's Climate Neutral Now accreditation and our environmental sustainability plan is focussed on achieving our net zero carbon target.
Each lawyer has the opportunity to undertake pro bono legal work for local charities and not-for-profit organisations. This has seen colleagues support the Great Western Air Ambulance Charity (Bristol), Moseley Road Swimming Baths (Birmingham), Yorkshire Cat Rescue (Leeds), Great Western Credit Union (London), and several others.

Everyone at DRPG has a purpose, and yours is to keep the cogs turning so that our sensational events dazzle our clients and audiences alike. You’ll be responsible for heads that turn and jaws that drop...challenge accepted?

A cracking ability working with MS Office applications (yes, even Excel…)

About Us

Across the FT Group, our people are united by a mission to deliver world-class information, news and services to our global audiences. We're a digital-first organisation made up of journalists, technologists, product managers, event planners, strategists, commercial and finance experts, marketing and communications specialists - and much more. Our strength is in our employees.

Our commitment to diversity and inclusion in the workplace

At the FT, we aim for employees across all regions to have a voice so that diverse perspectives are heard and valued. We believe that a supportive workplace is one where employees feel they can be themselves at work and have the flexibility they need to meet their personal needs. We'll continue to remove barriers for all, and in particular barriers facing employees from underrepresented groups.

About Longitude

Longitude, the Financial Times’ thought leadership business, is looking to recruit an Influencer Relations Executive & Assistant Editor to join our fast-growing team. An extensive induction and training programme is on offer, as well as exciting career progression opportunities.

The Role / Position Overview

The successful candidate will be responsible for identifying some of the most influential global experts in areas such as digital innovation, the future of the workforce, the transition to a net-zero economy, and then recruiting them for interview. They will carry out journalistic interviews, develop relationships with thought leaders, and work with senior editors to shape distinctive narratives on behalf of the world’s top B2B brands.

The role would suit a writer/editor at an early stage of their career as well as individuals with a broader interest in developing a career in content creation and thought leadership.

Key Responsibilities

Identify and recruit executives and thought leaders for interviews
Carry out interviews
Build and nurture a community of subject matter influencers, who can support on different projects and marketing initiatives over time
Identify and summarise emerging themes in interviews
Manage quote approvals and follow-up requests
Support the development and production of audio interviews (podcasts).

Required Skills / Experience

Desktop research
Social media research and communications
Interviewing (journalistic)
Identifying compelling themes and narratives
Clear writing and attention to detail
Understanding of key business themes
Stakeholder liaison and relationship building
Time-management and efficiency (with proficiency in relevant platforms)
Proactive and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

The FT has adopted a hybrid working policy as our new and future way of working; our teams enjoy a blended week with a few days from home and from our London HQ next to St Paul's Cathedral.

What’s in it for you? Our Benefits

Our benefits vary depending on location, but we are committed to providing best in class perks across all our offices as well as an inclusive environment to develop your career. Examples of our benefits include; generous annual leave allowances, flexible working (including working from home), medical cover, enhanced maternity & paternity packages, subsidised gym memberships and Giving Back opportunities. Full details of our benefits can be found here.

Further Information

The FT is committed to providing an inclusive working environment for all. We are an equal opportunities employer who seeks to recruit and appoint the best talent regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We also promote flexible working and will consider specific requests around flexibility for all roles where it can be accommodated. Please let us know if you require any adjustments as part of the application process or to enable you to attend an interview. If you would like to discuss your requirements, or have any questions, please contact a member of our HR team who will be happy to help.

c9e2450420105f24.description:
Who are we?

Six different automotive brands. Group Functions. Trade specialists.

Volkswagen Group is one of the most successful automotive manufacturers in the world, with some of the most iconic brands that the industry has ever seen. But we're also a great Sales, Marketing and Digital operation in our own right. Last year over 350,000 cars and vans were registered from the Volkswagen Group UK brands, achieving a market share of over 22% and confirming our position as the leading automotive company in the UK.

With a global target to be balance-sheet CO2 neutral by the year 2050, we are leading the automotive transition to zero emission battery electric vehicles. We're focusing on key strategic initiatives to help us become the leading provider of mobility services in the UK, digital sales, the next generation of aftersales and new efficient distribution structures to name a few.

We have a unique culture, built on difference and a friendly rivalry that inspires us all. Across our business, we learn from each other, encourage each other and regularly challenge each other to think differently adding value to our cultural agenda. Our people have a true passion for what they do, a genuine desire to go further for customers and to give their own careers real momentum at the same time.

What will you be doing?

We have an exciting opportunity for an undergraduate to join the ŠKODA team as a Digital Marketing Assistant. In this role you'll support the ŠKODA UK Digital team to develop and maintain a successful presence across all digital touchpoints. You'll work to create and maintain content for ŠKODA UK National website and WeLoveCycling UK website identifying opportunities and implementing changes.

Within this placement your role will be to ensure ŠKODA deliver a great digital user experience. You'll take on projects such as website improvements, app developments in close collaboration with our digital agencies in London. You'll also work closely with the product team and national communications team as well as having the opportunity to get involved in our media activity. Overall, this role offers a varied and flexible workload allowing you to learn and get hands on experience in many areas of the marketing and communications teams.

A placement here will immerse you in a busy, high-achieving marketing function for an internationally recognised brand. You'll be a core part of our marketing department to deliver national, local and digital campaigns across numerous channels whilst tracking the performance and achievement of KPIs. You'll drive customer engagement, sales leads and loyalty for our brands, whilst working on some of the most innovative communications projects across the automotive industry.

What's in it for you?

As an undergraduate on one of our placements, you'll receive a £20,000 salary, as well as a new car every six months (as long as you have a full, clean UK driving licence). You'll also receive 27 days' holiday – plus bank holidays – a discretionary bonus, an award-winning pension scheme, flexible benefits allowance, employee well-being support, an on-site restaurant and shopping discounts. Upon completion, you'll also have the opportunity to be considered for our Graduate Programme.

What do you need?

To be successful in this team you'll have ambition, a creative vision and a desire to learn. You'll have the ability to self-manage projects and deadlines and produce results demonstrating an aptitude for communication.

Our placement is open to any university student who is eligible to work full-time in the UK for twelve months from June/July 2022. You should be on a sandwich degree or course which offers a one-year industrial placement. We have a duty of care to our people and wouldn't want you to spend a large amount of time commuting, so we require our undergraduates to be based within a reasonable radius of our Milton Keynes head office.

What's the assessment process?

Once you have hit the apply button, we will send you a Numerical and Verbal reasoning assessment to complete. Upon successful completion of these, we will invite you to complete an online video interview so that we have a chance to get to know you a little more about you. Our final step in the journey would be for you to attend an interview. This process is designed to help us both work out if a placement here is the right step for you.

2dda0fadc052dce9.title: Events Assistant
2dda0fadc052dce9.description:
Kennedys is looking for an Events Assistant to join our Business Development team, in London. Kennedys' events are an integral part of its business development strategy. The Business Development department supports the firm's global growth ambition and its clients and markets.The successful Events Assistant will support the Events team, to produce high quality events that support the firm's global growth ambition and its business development objectives. To assist the wider Business Development (BD) department, primarily in an administrative capacity. They will work competently within the events team, contributing to the effectiveness of the business development department by providing a comprehensive and efficient service to internal and external clients in order that the business objectives of the firm and the department are achieved.

Team

Kennedys Business Development team promotes Kennedys services and supports the firm's global growth ambition and our key clients and markets.

The UK Business Development team consists of the following sub-teams, Pursuits, Clients and Markets, Publications, Client Development Systems and Marketing which encompasses, Digital, Brand and Events.

We also have a Business Development presence in six global offices.

Key Responsibilities

Support the Events team across a range of operational tasks in relation to scheduling, planning, delivering and analysing the effectiveness of client events.
With guidance from members of the events team, and other members of BD, to assist with smaller events (circa 50 attendees) to the highest standard of quality, typical duties include:
Drafting communication materials
Drafting highly targeted client lists
Managing on-site support
Collation of event evaluation and communication to Clients and Market team for follow up
Providing technical assistance and back-up on webinars, including being the second person on webinars, working with speakers to resolve any technical issues and managing any attendee issues.
Liaise with members of BD, lawyers, partners, facilities management, reception, catering, print room and external venues to ensure events are booked and delivered to the highest standard of quality.
Work with the Events team to ensure bespoke, targeted event lists are created for each event and research is undertaken to identify targets. Work closely with secretaries to ensure they know how to access event lists and add contacts to active lists - promoting the use of the firm's CRM system (InterAction) at all times.

Additional Responsibilities

Ensure Kennedys' website, intranet pages/calendar and event spreadsheet are up to date with the latest event details including invitations lists for internal purposes.
Create high quality and imaginative electronic event invitations that are drafted in a non-technical way that informs clients about the subject matter. Ensure events are promoted internally including pre-event promotion and post-event promotion e.g. intranet stories and news items.
Assist with pre- and post-event administrative tasks and on-site support (e.g. updating the event scheduler, room bookings, producing badges, preparing materials, updating CRM database, analysing feedback etc.). Meet and greet clients in a highly professional manner.
Editing and uploading webinar recordings to our website and e-marketing programme (Vuture)
Manage the Events mailbox (rsvp@kennedyslaw.com) to ensure queries are responded within an agreed timeframe.
Co-ordinate, including researching and ordering of marketing merchandise. Liaise with suppliers to source creative branded merchandise to be used at events or for other marketing purposes.
To support the Client Development Systems team to maintain the integrity of the data in the firm's CRM system (InterAction)
Collating presentations and sending them to the Knowledge Management team weekly.
Managing set up of events on the Kennedys app and the administrative tasks of ensuring the app is up to date (e.g. removing events over 3 months old)
Training secretaries/trainees/apprentices when assisting at events, including online registration and badge creation
As a member of the Marketing and Communications team and the wider BD team provide support when required for the delivery of the services that they provide to the business - e.g. publications, other communications, etc.

Required experience

Good attention to detail and writing skills.
Organised and methodical.
Professional, in presentation and manner, at all times.
Calm under pressure.
Comfortable operating to tight deadlines.
Good IT skills, especially Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Good written and verbal communication skills
Flexible and adaptable, comfortable with change.
Enthusiastic and optimistic attitude; commitment to profitable growth by Kennedys.
Adhere to Kennedys' core values through working relationships, attitude and behaviour.
Professional services experience is an advantage desirable
Good understanding of the various pressures lawyers work under desirable
Experience of e-marketing and CRM systems - ideally InterAction and Vuture Vx desirable

About Kennedys

Kennedys is a global law firm with expertise in dispute resolution and advisory services. With over 2,300 people worldwide across 43 offices in the UK, Europe, Middle East, Asia Pacific and America we have some of the most respected legal minds in their field.

Our lawyers handle both contentious and non-contentious matters, and provide a range of specialist legal services, for many industry sectors but we have particular expertise in litigation and dispute resolution, especially in defending insurance and liability claims.

We're a fresh-thinking firm, and we're not afraid to bring challenging new perspectives to the table way beyond the traditional realm of legal services. We empower our clients with a diverse range of ideas, tools and technology to make their lives easier, as well as delivering exceptional results, every time.

What do we have to offer?

We welcome high-performing lawyers, business services professionals, secretaries, graduates and apprentices to join our rapidly expanding global firm. Whatever your role at Kennedys, you'll be involved in exciting and stimulating work, where your input will make a difference.

Our culture and values form a big part of who we are and we take them seriously. We make a difference by being approachable,straightforward, supportive and distinctive. Our values are at the core of who we are and what make us a great firm to work with and for.

We develop careers in an innovative and collaborative global environment, with our values at the core. We believe that supporting individual growth and development puts us in the best position to attract and retain talented individuals. Regardless of role or level, everyone has access to virtual learning to help you develop your skills, wherever you are in the world. A variety of other exciting opportunities are available including secondments to clients and our global offices as well as a comprehensive benefits package (details are available upon request).

We've created a culture based on client service, professional excellence, hard work and trust. We deeply value the relationships we build with our clients and we know that they value our warm, friendly human approach. We are here to provide answers, recommendations, strategy and tactics.

Kennedys is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to ensuring our recruitment processes are as inclusive as possible. We expect all employees to be aware of and comply with all relevant policies and procedures within their jurisdiction, including those relating to Information Security, Data Protection and Quality Management, refer any breach promptly to Risk & Compliance and to complete all mandatory training when requested.

Apprentice Marketing Assistant

Level 4


ITM Power
Location: Sheffield


About ITM Power


ITM Power Plc is a globally recognised expert in hydrogen technologies with the overarching principle to take excess energy from the power network, convert it into hydrogen and use it in one of three broad market areas – Mobility, Power-to-X and Industry. There are multiple application areas within each area, all of which are acknowledged to be growing rapidly and requiring systems of ever larger capacities. This is led by the drive for improved air quality worldwide, the growth of renewable power generators and a need to decarbonise industrial processes. ITM Power is a growing company in this fast- paced, exciting sector and designs and builds equipment called electrolysers which take water and renewable energy to generate green hydrogen, the perfect green energy option.


Why join us


Our business is entering a significant period of transition, undertaking a period of rapid growth and transformation and we have recently moved into our new global facilities in Sheffield. As an Apprentice you will play a valued role within ITM where you will be supported every step of the way. You will receive on the job training and a nationally recognised qualification, earning while you learn and we will provide you with all of the practical skills and knowledge to help you achieve this. You will be working with an inspiring bunch of people, delivering best in class performance, who all share our desire, commitment and ambition to succeed. Our talented team of individuals display energy and enthusiasm with the ability to adapt to ever evolving business needs, encouraging each other to be the best we can. Help us to shape the future and join us for the rest of this incredible journey!


What are we looking for


ITM Power’s Marketing Department is responsible for implementing and delivering marketing strategies across all areas of the business and look after a wide aspect of communications, from internal communications, to design, branding, trade shows, press and media, project communications, financial reports, supporting the sales team, generating leads, brochure design, websites… and much more!

We’re looking for a Marketing Assistant who is interested in and excited about the prospect of working within a business that is all about sustainability. To be successful within ITM Power requires an individual that can work at pace, use their own initiative and is capable of juggling a variety of marketing tasks in a given timeframe.


The position will work in close partnership with Marketing Managers, Head of Marketing and Content Creation Specialist, all of whom are responsible for planning, developing and delivering outstanding content and campaigns to engage and inspire our stakeholders. You will be studying for your Level 4 qualification.


Responsibilities


Support with the delivery of marketing campaigns
Collaborate with team in the creation of marketing materials for social/web/print
Assist with the creation of design briefs
Coordinate company stationary requirements
Raise purchase orders for the department
Help maintain product information online
Assist with internal communications
Liaise with a range of stakeholders: internal, suppliers and external agencies
Support email marketing campaigns
Help coordinate company presentations
Contribute to marketing plans
Research - opportunities, competitors etc
Marketing administration support
Event Management support


About You


Degree Subject/Qualifications Required


Marketing/Communications / Business Admin experience / knowledge
5 GCSEs (or equivalent) at grade 5.5/B or above which must include English Language and Mathematics


Skills and Abilities


As a Marketing Assistant you will have a natural eye for detail, you will have a creative style when it comes to both visual and editorial content along with being able to act as a Brand Ambassador. Be meticulous in your approach and ensure that all material produced is enticing and showcases ITM in the best way possible.


Strong communication skills with excellent interpersonal skills
A flair for creativity and content writing
Excellent IT skills with MS products
Ability to multi task and be highly organised
Excellent attention to detail
Excellent time management and the ability to work to deadlines
Highly organised approach and commitment to closing and completing tasks


Personal Attributes

Excited about developing marketing techniques
Enjoy working to deadlines
Eager to contribute to our marketing strategy and processes
Motivated, enthusiastic, a positive ‘can do’ attitude


Training and Development
This opportunity will provide firsthand experience into the world of marketing and the successful candidate will develop and learn throughout their placement with the opportunity to work with experienced marketing professionals in a rapidly growing business.
What can we offer you


A competitive salary of £16,000 per annum, 37.5 hours per week, 25 days holiday per year plus your birthday day off and a wider range of benefits. We know your career is important to you, it’s important to us too, so if you are looking to join a dynamic business and want to be part of our amazing team we would love to hear from you.

Our success is driven by the exceptional diversity of our people. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, committed to promoting and creating a diverse and inclusive environment where we encourage our employees to learn and grow, fuelled by mutual respect in a place where ideas flow and thrive.

Closing Date for Applications 4th April 2022
Apprenticeship Start Date September 2022

An opportunity has risen for a hardworking, competent and enthusiastic individual to join our busy Group Marketing Department, based at our offices in Lincoln. You’ll be joining a friendly, fun, practical, and inspiring community where every day is different.

The role offers an exciting opportunity to become a valued member of our close-knit Team, assisting with a variety of activities which include:

Writing bids and answering questions for tenders, frameworks and pre-qualification questionnaires.

What We’re Looking For

Qualifications and Experience

A Degree in English, Marketing, Public Relations or Journalism (or similar) would be an advantage.

You will ideally have experience in a similar role. Experience with digital marketing, social media and other online communications would be an advantage. An understanding of social value, sustainability or the construction industry generally would also be useful.

A full driving licence is essential, as the role involves work-related travel using company vehicles.

‘The difference is our people’ and above all we are seeking someone with the right skills and attitude. We are seeking someone who is:

a team player, willing to learn and share ideas and work closely with colleagues responsible for the Group’s Marketing, PR and Communications, Bids and Business Development.

competent using Microsoft Office. Experience with graphic/visual design would be an advantage, specifically use of Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and/or InDesign, although training will be given.

The role is full-time, 40 hours per week (8.30am to 5.30pm, Monday to Friday) and based at our offices on Lindum Business Park on Station Road, North Hykeham.

If you have what we’re looking for and would like to join our close-knit team, please complete the application form and attach your CV or email [email protected]. Interviews will be taking place the week commencing 21st March 2022.

Find us on Twitter, LinkedIn and Instagram.

Job description
Your opportunity
Deloitte has established a clear vision to become the undisputed leader in professional services. The Clients and Industries (C&I) strategy is a key enabler of this vision; aiming to build enviable client loyalty with the largest, most influential and fastest-growing clients in our chosen markets, so that these clients turn first to Deloitte when faced with a major challenge.
In our Yorkshire and North East (Y&NE) practice we are looking for a Senior Assistant to join our regional C&I team to support Partners and the wider business in engaging with our clients in a meaningful way – whether that is through peer-to-peer communities like our Next Generation CFO programme, events, sharing leading insights or social media campaigns. In our region we are particularly proud to be leading the way in how we collaborate with others on ‘Path to Net Zero’, bringing together local businesses to drive positive climate action.
The individual will support the C&I team in the delivery of the FY22 marketing and communications plan and establish and maintain strong relationships and channels of communication between the team, the local practice and wider pan-regional and national C&I teams.
We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.
Your role
Strategy:
Support the implementation and measurement of the regional marketing and communications plan to drive revenue growth, strengthen relationships and raise market/brand profile
Work with the Y&NE C&I team to prioritise areas requiring support in order to successfully and efficiently implement the regional plan, whilst also responding to emerging market issues
Work with stakeholders to drive engagement with (and reflect the needs of) our key regional clients in our C&I activity
Attend to internal/external stakeholder needs in a timely, professional and helpful manner.
Marketing, portfolio, brand & eminence:
Create and deliver impactful marketing activity which responds to the business priorities
Support stakeholders in planning and executing relevant, high quality marketing campaigns across all channels
Provide business analysis, administrative and project management support to ensure the smooth execution of marketing campaigns
Support the delivery of key virtual and face-to-face events, maximising the use of leading-edge technology and tools
Support the team in delivering the external communications strategy across traditional and digital media
Lead the internal marketing communications programme for the regional practice
Support the C&I Portfolio Lead in the delivery of the priority accounts programme
Support the C&I team in embedding standard processes and methodologies as they relate to campaign and portfolio management
Work effectively in diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contribution.
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.
Location: You will be based at our Leeds office, with an option of working from home on a flexible basis. Some domestic travel will be required.
Work pattern: This is a permanent contract opportunity. The role is on a full-time basis.
Your professional experience
The applicant should have:
Excellent communication skills
Excellent demonstrable organisational skills
Excellent project management skills and experience
Excellent attention to detail
Good interpersonal skills
An ability and eagerness to learn and progress in marketing
Database and CRM experience
Social media experience
Ability to manage and develop relationships at all levels
A professional ‘can do’ attitude and the ability to be a team player
Ability to work under pressure/to deadlines
Ability to handle responsibility
This role requires an individual who will be proactive, robust, provide challenge to the wider practice on marketing campaigns, confidently deliver at all meetings and contribute to maintaining the strong reputation held by the Clients & Industries team within the practice.
Desirable
Experience in the professional services sector preferable but not obligatory
Educated to degree level in a relevant business / marketing subject or equivalent experience
CIM qualified.
Your service line: Enabling Functions
At Deloitte, we’re all about making an impact that matters, together. And nowhere is this more apparent than among our 2,000 strong Enabling Functions teams. With our combined specialist skills and business partnering expertise, we provide all the essential strategy, support and advice our client-facing colleagues need, right across the firm. This enables them to focus all of their efforts on delivering the best service possible to their clients. So not only will you be providing world-class support to our internal clients, you’ll be making an impact for all the hugely influential organisations Deloitte works with too. Covering all our distinct areas: Human Resources, Clients & Industries, Finance & Legal, Central Business Services, National Quality & Risk Management, Technology & Digital Services, and Real Estate, the opportunities here are vast. And what’s more, you can grow your career in whatever direction you choose. We’ll support you all the way.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.
About Deloitte
Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Central Mediterranean (Italy, Greece, Malta), Ireland, the Middle East (Bahrain, Cyprus, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Oman, Palestinian Ruled Territories, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen), the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,700 partners and over 50,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It’s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.
Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work – and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we’re looking for:
We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they make
We develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities
We drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and borders
We believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior people
We move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.

Overview:
Curzon Media is in business to create relationships: relationships between us and our clients and, above all, relationships between our clients and their customers. We need a talented, dynamic and creative individual to join us on our exciting journey. Our ideal candidate is a visual genius with a superb eye, excellent writer, and social media junkie; highly motivated and brilliantly aware of the sectors we focus on. So if you’re a talented Social Media & Content Assistant with a particular interest or experience in fashion, entertainment, automotive, travel, and financial services, we want to speak to you.
GETTING SOCIAL
You’ll report to the Social Media Editor and join our fast-paced team, assisting in the production of industry-leading social media and blog imagery and content from concept to execution. You’ll also assist in the management of Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and YouTube accounts and help produce social imagery.
DEVILS IN THE DETAIL
You’ll need an obsessive attention to detail and a track record of operating in a fast-paced environment. The role will require you to play an integral part in identifying key influencers and partnerships for blog content, photo shooting and editing exclusive imagery and coordinating features with external parties as well as internal buying and planning teams. You will need to have a particular focus on growing the quantity and quality of our client’s content.
THE FUN STUFF
You’ll be responsible for shooting and capturing content for social media and blogs, liaising with external contacts, such as fashion, entertainment, automotive, travel, and financial services representatives, to coordinating shoots and interviews. We also need you to suggest ideas and develop concepts for editorial stories working with ‘on the ground’ content creators to enrich these accounts and grow followers.
EAR TO THE GROUND
You’ll be expected to produce weekly feedback for each account that you cover to steer content according to our client’s business direction and brand guidelines and report on competitor activity and stay up to date with new social media channels. Growing the quantity, quality and reach of each sector is key and to do this you’ll have to source on-brand imagery for use across content channels, securing appropriate usage rights and planning and coordinating social editorial shoots, including content selection and sign off as well as assisting on location and in post-shoot editing.
TOO CLEVER BY HALF
So if you are outstanding, witty and possess creative editorial skills, are proficient in Adobe Photoshop, have experience shooting with DSLR cameras, can demonstrate a strong work ethic and willingness to learn – we would love to speak to you. Add to this Custom Wordpress template experience, a basic HTML understanding and moving image creation and editing, along with a good knowledge of Microsoft Office: Word/ Excel/ Outlook and a keen interest in all things social media – then you’re on to a winner.
SWEET TASTE OF SUCCESS
On offer is a competitive base salary, 28 days annual leave (including flexible bank holidays) and company bonus scheme for all. You will also find us socialising in the pub, especially when we finish early on a Friday in summer (optional) bake cakes on Wednesdays (compulsory), compete at office ping-pong and join a team that is making a real difference.
Sound like the right career move for you? Email your CV to hr@curzonmedia.com

6086a8a4f184cae1.description:
What does a UKOC Ambassador & Events Specialist do?
The UKOC (Operations Centre) is responsible for the production and supply of Bacardi’s Scotch Whisky and Gin, including DEWAR’S®, ABFERFELDY® and BOMBAY SAPPHIRE®.
The UKOC Ambassador & Events Specialist is a varied role providing our guests with a seamless experience to our site, conveying the quality of our product as well as our heritage and culture. Additionally, this role will lead key internal and external engagement activities for the UKOC, such as managing our onsite bar and fostering a strong relationship with our commercial partners and the community. You will spearhead initiatives such as our annual Founders Day celebrations, CSR events, Reward & Recognition activities, and branded workwear refreshes.
This role is responsible for running and managing the reception area and activities but flexibility on core activities will be key. The role will also help assist with in-house events and be responsible for the mailroom and conference areas.
About You
You will have experience and background in a front of house reception, be well organised, able to prioritise workload in an ever-changing environment and possess excellent communication skills. You will have a proactive and can-do attitude with the ability to respond quickly and effectively. With excellent interpersonal and customer service skills, you welcome visitors to our site in line with our values and culture. You will be able to build strong relationships with primos at all levels of the organisation.
You will have experience in an administrative role and be proactive and willing to learn new tasks, always looking to execute to a high level and improve processes. You will have strong organisational skills and be able to multitask varying priorities
This would be an ideal position for a graduate who is looking for an entry into Communications, Marketing, or HR.
Hours: Monday – Thursday 8 AM – 4:30 PM; Friday 8 AM – 12 PM
Please note, this is an onsite role that is not eligible for remote working.
Responsibilities
With our Consumer at the heart, your key focus will be to:
Be the face of our brands as the first person visitors meet onsite. Create a 5-star experience for visitors to our site by welcoming them to our local site and keeping a FOH
Core front of house duties, e.g. welcoming guests and informing the local contact of their arrival, answering phone, responsibility of managing meeting rooms and relevant catering options, complete opening and closing procedures, assisting all visitors in administration needs like taxi bookings, offering/collecting PPE, refreshments, communications for Visitors (e.g. Safety video; visitor maps) etc.
Act as a local brand ambassador, driving the communication of the quality and authenticity of the brands and their intrinsic values. Brand Advocacy and Brand Connections. Actively seek out opportunities to increase JDSL/UKOC profile within Bacardi and community.
Responsibility of the on-site company bar area including completing stock checks, bar displays, and organising events such as masterclasses and mixology sessions.
Responsible for the co-ordination and implementation of inhouse events and brand/heritage initiatives such as Founder’s Day, Back to the Bar, and Back to the Shelf
Lead Reward and Recognition initiatives for the UKOC – including the Above and Beyond programme / Reward & Recognition Committee, the Spot Recognition programme for managers, and promoting/tracking metrics for the Cheers platform
Coordinate Branded Workwear refreshes with the aim of building brand pride in our organisation. Seek and incorporate primo pride and ensure products reflect quality of our brands
Ensure the conference areas reflect the standards required and liaising with the relevant business areas to facilitate visitors to attend tours as required.
Ad-hoc Administrative support within the HR team such as:
Reward & Recognition, Product Allowance, and gift issues
Issuing / mailing and supporting relevant comms e.g. bulk mailers
Raising purchase orders
Managing mailroom and stationary orders
Support audits
HR Metrics & reporting
Ad-hoc communications on Dewar’s Connection
Support engagement initiatives across the business and any other tasks as set
Skills and Experience
The Skills & Experience needed to create your legacy
Have experience and background in a front of house role.
Be well organised and possess excellent communication skills.
A good background and knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) is needed.
Experience of SAP would be advantageous.
The following experiences are preferred:
Bachelors Degree in HR, Business Management, Marketing or equivalent
Personal Qualities:
High energy and flexibility
Role model for 3 F’s culture (Fearless, Founders’ Mentality, and Family)
A warm and welcoming manner and ability to interact in an engaging and professional manner with all levels.
Be pro-active with the ability to respond quickly and effectively in a changing environment.
A customer care attitude and strong sense of excellence in service (“a ringing phone cannot be ignored”).
Able to prioritise workload and meet tight deadlines.
A passionate ambassador of our site, people and brands. An interest in expanding their remit and role to ensure that all visitors have a 5-star experience.
Our culture
We share the passion and entrepreneurial flair of our founder and are guided by our three culture pillars - Fearless, Family and Founders, they inspire our Primos to be the best they can be and drive us forward in all we do. But what does this mean? Being Fearless; means adopting an agile mindset, being comfortable trying new things and taking risks. We are empowered to question, challenge and innovate. Family; We treat each other, and our communities, like Family. Always.
 Founders; The spirit of entrepreneurship is at the heart of everything we do. We see the business as if it’s our own. We do the right thing for the business and we all take accountability for our work.
When you join Bacardi, you become part of our family and gain more than just a job.
Disclaimer: Bacardi is an equal opportunity employer that values workforce diversity. Diversity is core to our business: by embedding diversity into all aspects of our culture, we maximize the opportunity to achieve sustainable business success and growth. A unique opportunity has become available for a business to business (B2B) marketing assistant to join our Digital Ventures marketing team.

You will be joining a growing part of the business with lots of opportunities to take on additional responsibility. The role will involve leading on social media and supporting a range of other marketing initiatives. As the role is varied across the spectrum of B2B marketing activities, you’ll be able to develop broad skills as a marketer and have a positive impact on our growth and mission.

You will develop and manage a successful B2B social media strategy to position us at the forefront of the industry, overseeing implementation and results.  As part of these activities, your responsibilities will include:
Designing and delivering B2B social media campaigns to support organisational objectives, using best practice methods and creative ideas
Working with subject matter experts to deliver marketing campaigns that generate engagement and opportunities, and start conversations
Coordinating the production of high quality marketing content and helping to manage webinars and events
Moderating and interacting with posts from our community members and encouraging ongoing discussions to grow our community
Fostering and strengthening new relationships with key influencers within the community
Developing a strong understanding of client businesses, their business problems, and the markets in which they operate
Staying abreast of industry trends and key competitors’ marketing activities to identify areas of opportunity
Planning and participating in the launch of new services, products, and partnerships agreements, which involves several different departments

We would like to hear from candidates ideally with a university degree in a marketing, communications, business studies or a relevant discipline along with the following knowledge and experience:
Previous experience of working as a marketing or social media executive ideally within a B2B environment
Deep interest in marketing with the ability to ask questions, challenge the status quo, with a test and learn mindset. You’re excited about the vision we have and ready to offer fresh insights and ideas to grow engagement and awareness.
Insight and experience in using social media platforms (particularly LinkedIn and Twitter) and a desire to keep up with the latest trends and make the most of opportunities
Knowledge of coordinating marketing material production
Experience of translating technical subject matters into engaging content to appeal to target audiences
Ability to manage your time effectively, prioritise workload and deliver to deadlines, with strong stakeholder management skills
Advanced communication and writing skills are crucial

Along with the above we are looking for someone with excellent English language skills who is an adaptable team player with the ability to work across multiple products, services, and teams.
