Job description
Your opportunity
Deloitte has established a clear vision to become the undisputed leader in professional services. The Clients and Industries (C&I) strategy is a key enabler of this vision; aiming to build enviable client loyalty with the largest, most influential and fastest-growing clients in our chosen markets, so that these clients turn first to Deloitte when faced with a major challenge.
In our Midlands practice we are looking for a Senior Assistant to join our regional C&I team to support Partners and the wider business in engaging with our clients in a meaningful way – whether that is through events, sharing and tailoring leading industry or regional insights, or social media campaigns.
The individual will support the C&I team in the delivery of the FY22 marketing and communications plan and establish and maintain strong relationships and channels of communication between the team, the local practice (both East and West Midlands) and wider pan-regional and national C&I teams. They will report to the C&I Lead.
We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.
Your role
Strategy:
Support the implementation and measurement of the regional marketing and communications plan to drive revenue growth, strengthen relationships and raise market/brand profile
Work with the Midlands C&I team to prioritise areas requiring support in order to successfully and efficiently implement the regional plan, whilst also responding to emerging market issues
Work with stakeholders to drive engagement with (and reflect the needs of) our key regional clients in our C&I activity
Attend to internal/external stakeholder needs in a timely, professional and helpful manner.
Marketing, portfolio, brand & eminence:
Create and deliver impactful marketing activity (events, creation of marketing material and digital assets i.e. video) which responds to the business priorities
Support stakeholders in planning and executing relevant, high quality marketing campaigns
Provide business analysis, administrative and project management support to ensure the smooth execution of marketing campaigns
Support the delivery of key virtual and face-to-face events, maximising the use of leading-edge technology and tools
Support internal marketing communications for the regional practice i.e. writing and designing email updates, creation of video material
Support the C&I team in embedding standard processes and methodologies as they relate to campaign and portfolio management
Work effectively in diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contribution.
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.
Location: You will be based at our Birmingham office, with an option of working from home on a flexible basis. Some domestic travel will be required.
Work pattern: This is a permanent contract opportunity. The role is on a full-time basis.
Your professional experience
The applicant should have:
Excellent communication skills, especially written
Excellent demonstrable organisational skills
Excellent project management skills and experience
Excellent attention to detail
Good interpersonal skills
An ability and eagerness to learn and progress in marketing
Database and CRM experience
Some social media understanding and experience
Ability to manage and develop relationships at all levels incl. senior stakeholders
A professional ‘can do’ attitude and the ability to be a team player
Ability to work under pressure/to deadlines
Ability to handle responsibility
This role requires an individual who will be proactive, robust, provide challenge to the wider practice on marketing campaigns, confidently deliver at all meetings and contribute to maintaining the strong reputation held by the Clients & Industries team within the practice.
Desirable
Experience in the professional services sector preferable, but not obligatory
Experience or training in copywriting and/or design and branding preferable, but not obligatory
Educated to degree level in a relevant business / marketing subject, or, equivalent experience
Your service line: Enabling Functions
At Deloitte, we’re all about making an impact that matters, together. And nowhere is this more apparent than among our 2,000 strong Enabling Functions teams. With our combined specialist skills and business partnering expertise, we provide all the essential strategy, support and advice our client-facing colleagues need, right across the firm. This enables them to focus all of their efforts on delivering the best service possible to their clients. So not only will you be providing world-class support to our internal clients, you’ll be making an impact for all the hugely influential organisations Deloitte works with too. Covering all our distinct areas: Human Resources, Clients & Industries, Finance & Legal, Central Business Services, National Quality & Risk Management, Technology & Digital Services, and Real Estate, the opportunities here are vast. And what’s more, you can grow your career in whatever direction you choose. We’ll support you all the way.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.
About Deloitte
Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Central Mediterranean (Italy, Greece, Malta), Ireland, the Middle East (Bahrain, Cyprus, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Oman, Palestinian Ruled Territories, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen), the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,700 partners and over 50,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It’s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.
Being a Leader at Deloitte

They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work – and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.

3ac7a4276cc14997.title: Assistant Editor
3ac7a4276cc14997.description: About usThe Geological Society of London is the UK’s professional body for Earth sciences and aims to improve knowledge and understanding of the Earth, to promote Earth science education and awareness, and to support professional excellence in the work of Earth scientists for the public good. Founded in 1807, it is the oldest national geological society in the world and is both a professional body and a learned society.Today, the Geological Society is a world-leading communicator of Earth science through its scholarly publishing, library and information services, leading-edge scientific conferences, educational activities and public outreach. It publishes a range of internationally recognised scientific journals and thematic volumes that are available online and in print to its members and to libraries worldwide (www.lyellcollection.org). The Society has built a reputation for providing policy-makers with impartial and authoritative input and advice based on sound science, including potentially contentious issues such as shale gas, radioactive waste, and mineral extraction (www.geolsoc.org.uk/geology-for-society).The Society has a membership (Fellowship) of c. 11,600, more than 2,000 of which are based outside the UK. Approximately 3,000 are Chartered Geologists or Chartered Scientists - professionals who have demonstrated a high level of technical competence in their field and a commitment to professional ethics. The Society is licensed by the European Federation of Geologists to award the title of European Geologist and works with partner bodies in the UK to maintain specialist professional registers. It also accredits undergraduate and MSc degree programmes, and in-house professional training schemes provided by employers.The Society is a registered charity, with an annual turnover of nearly £5 million, a balance sheet of £10 million, and a staff of around 50 located in London and Bath.Our strategyIn 2020 the Society undertook a review of strategic options, building on its 2017-27 strategy. Arising from this work the Society’s four strategic aims for the coming years are to:· Advance multidisciplinary Earth science to inform global issues,· Support professional development, careers and education in Earth science,· Be the inclusive and collaborative home for UK Earth scientists and increase our international orientation, and· Become a dynamic and responsive organisation with a strong digital identity.Embedded within the Society’s 2017 Strategy are our values:· We strive to be impartial, authoritative, trustworthy and transparent,· We promote diversity, equality, inclusion and respect for others across the geoscience community,· We promote social and environmental sustainability, responsibility and stewardship, and· We seek opportunities to work collaboratively and aim to be recognised as a valued partner.Our peopleThe Society employs c. 50 staff at its offices in London and Bath. It is governed by a 23-strong Council of trustees representing the wider membership. The Council is led and chaired by the President, who is elected for a two-year term. Honorary Secretaries and Vice-Presidents from within the Council are responsible for key areas of activity.Volunteers play an essential role in running the Society and delivering its activities, working in partnership with the staff, participating in committees and working groups, convening conferences, editing publications and taking part in communication and outreach work.The Senior Leadership Team consists of the Executive Secretary and three Directors:· Executive Secretary – responsible for the leadership and management of staff at Burlington House in London and at the Publishing House in Bath,· Director of Finance & Operations – responsible for finance, membership, facilities, health and safety, information systems and human resources functions,· Director of Science & Communications – responsible for science, policy, education, external communication, and conferences/events, and library and information services based in London, and· Director of Publishing – responsible for the Society’s scientific publishing operations based in Bath.Job DescriptionRole: Assistant EditorSalary: £13,000 - £14,000 (£26,000 - £28,000 FTE), commensurate with experienceReports to: Executive Editor, Geoscientist magazineDirect reports: NoneContract: Part-time, 2.5 days per week (0.5 FTE), permanentLocation: Hybrid (one day per week in Burlington House, London), with the option for fully remote workingPurpose of the roleThe Assistant Editor supports the Executive Editor in the day-to-day running and timely production of Geoscientist magazine, in print and online, and is part of the magazine’s Editorial Advisory Panel.ResponsibilitiesThe Assistant Editor is primarily responsible for the Books & Arts, 5 Minutes With, and Obituary sections of the magazine, and oversees the Geoscientist social media accounts. The Assistant Editor can contribute to other sections of the magazine, as time allows. Duties include:· Assessing content submissions and making recommendations on their publication to senior editorial staff· Commissioning, editing (for accuracy, readability and timeliness), proofing, and writing content, for print, online and social media· Maintaining liaisons between the authors and editorial team· Helping to respond to author queries (e.g. relating to formatting, deadlines, copyright)· Uploading text and images to our websites using our content management systems· Generating ideas for magazine content, in print and onlineBooks & ArtsThe Books & Arts section comprises reviews of geoscience-related publications and cultural events, including books, exhibitions and films/documentaries. The Assistant Editor is responsible for the commissioning, editing and online publication of these reviews, as well as managing and tracking the content (by, for example, liaising with book publishers to secure interesting, geoscience-related titles).5 Minutes withAn informal interview with an interesting geoscientist wraps up each Geoscientist issue. The Assistant Editor will work together with the Executive Editor to identify suitable interviewees, and commission and edit the interviews.ObituariesThe Assistant Editor is responsible for the commissioning, editing and online publication of obituaries for Fellows of the Society. The Assistant Editor also tracks and compiles the ‘In memory of’ list for each issue of Geoscientist.Social mediaThe Assistant Editor oversees the day-to-day running of the Geoscientist social media accounts (in particular promoting the new issue content each quarter), selects tweets for inclusion in the magazine print issues, and implements promotional strategies to encourage digital engagement with Geoscientist.Online.OtherThe Assistant Editor is welcome to contribute to other sections of the magazine, including writing for the magazine, as time allows, and is encouraged to take responsibility for an increased volume of magazine content as part of their development.Person specificationThe successful candidate should be able to demonstrate the following qualifications, qualities and experience:· A degree in geoscience (or a related field) or a degree in science communication/journalism, with knowledge of the Earth sciences· Excellent English language, written and communication skills· High level of IT proficiency and full familiarity with the normal range of office software· Highly self-motivated, capable of juggling projects, generating ideas, prioritizing deadlines and meeting the demands of a fast-paced publishing environment· Broad knowledge of and a passion for the Earth sciences· Prior experience in science communication and/or scientific editing or publishing is highly beneficial· Knowledge of WordPress websites and social media account management is desirable, but not essentialGeoscientistGeoscientist is the magazine of the Geological Society of London. Featuring a vibrant mix of science, opinion, news, interviews and more, Geoscientist serves as a resource for the community, with articles that aim to inspire interest within and across many fields of expertise.Geoscientist has global reach, with quarterly print issues that are freely distributed to the ~11,600 Fellows of the Geological Society of London worldwide, as well as at international conferences, careers fairs and educational institutes. Our digital and multimedia content is also freely available to all at www.Geoscientist.Online.Geoscientist helps reinforce Fellowship in a tangible way, and facilitates communication between the Society and its Fellows, as well as the broader Earth science community. Geoscientist is editorially independent of the Council and Secretariat of the Society, and provides a forum for Fellows’ feedback on the Society and its actions.Find out more about Geoscientist and the Editorial Team here: www.Geoscientist.Online/about/How to applyTo apply for this position, please forward a copy of your CV together with a cover letter. Please ensure that your cover letter fully addresses the appointment criteria in the person specification.Please let us know if you will require any special provisions to be made should you be called for an interview.As part of our inclusive recruitment initiative we have introduced the concept of blind recruiting in order to evaluate applicants solely on their skills and experience. With this in mind, we encourage you to:Anonymise your application by stating only your initials in your CV and cover letter.State your initials only in the subject line when sending your application.Ensure that you have included your contact number, as well as dates when you will not be available or might have difficulty with the indicative timetable.All applicants must have the right to work in the UK.The Society is an equal opportunities employer. The post-holder will be expected to adhere to and support the Society’s commitment to diversity, equality and inclusion.RECRUITMENT TIMETABLEClosing date for applications: Midnight 16 March 2022Interviews: Week commencing 28 March 2022Job starts: We hope to fill the role by May 2022These dates may be subject to change.If you have any queries on any aspect of the appointment process please contact the HR Manager.Job Types: Part-time, PermanentPart-time hours: 17.5 per weekSalary: £13,000.00-£14,000.00 per yearBenefits:Company pensionCycle to work schemeFlexible scheduleLife insuranceWork from homeApplication deadline: 16/03/2022Reference ID: GSLAssistantEditor

8cfb11cc841b18dd.title: Creative Marketing Assistant
8cfb11cc841b18dd.description:
Creative Marketing Assistant

Brand Engagement and Customer Experience
Exete r / Truro




We are an award-winning, employee-owned law firm, where our people are the heart of our business. We have been

listed as one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For in the UK for the last seven years!
A vacancy has arisen for a Creative Marketing Assistant to work in the Brand Engagement and Customer Experience Team

in our Exeter or Truro Office. This is a permanent, full time role working 9am-5.15pm, Monday to Friday.


Stephens Scown is a leading law firm offering a wide range of legal services to clients across the South West. Our values

are at the core of everything we do which means everyone works to deliver the highest standard. The firm currently has 300

employees across its offices in Exeter, St Austell and Truro.


The Role:

As a Creative Marketing Assistant, you will have an interesting and varied workload which involves supporting members of

the Creative team and internal stakeholders to coordinate and produce creative collateral and events, utilising in-house

assets and working closely with others in the team on ‘client stories’ and their use to grow our client base.


Reporting to the Creative Marketing Manager, you will be working closely with a wider team and have regular interaction with

the Digital, Communications and Client teams. You will be also involved in projects on employer brand, which will require

liaison with the HR Team and other business support teams.


Your day-to-day tasks and responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
 Maintaining documents accuracy including collateral
 Reacting to requests for new material
 Implementing actions from within pre-determined marketing plans
 Supporting the Creative Marketing Executive with stakeholder management of legal team relationships
 Supporting legal teams and members of the Brand Engagement and Customer Experience team with sponsorships

and professional relationship administration
 Audit the quality and timeliness of our collateral and run a program of review and edits to keep up-to-date
 Support for geographical-based events and acting as a point of contact for professionals’ groups
 Undertaking research and competitor analysis of creative projects and trends as required
Are you the right person?

The ideal candidate will have a minimum of three years’ experience of working in a marketing function with a direct

experience of the full marketing mix with a focus on campaigns, events, creative collateral and implementing marketing

campaigns.


You will be highly organised with an ability to plan and manage a busy workload and priorities across multiple projects while

staying calm under pressure and maintaining focus on tasks to meet deadlines.


You will need to have a flexible approach and the ability to work within a team environment.


This position would suit someone who is creative and enjoys a variable and busy workload. Good interpersonal and IT skills

(Excel, PowerPoint, Word), excellent oral and written communication skills and attention to detail are essential for this role.


What we can offer you:

In return you will be offered a competitive salary, 25 days’ holiday per year, life assurance and private medical insurance

schemes.


If this sounds like you and you would like to be considered for this opportunity, please send your application by email

(quoting your current or last salary) enclosing an up to date CV to humanresources@stephens-scown.co.uk or by post to:


HR Department, Stephens Scown LLP, Curzon House, Southernhay West, Exeter, EX1 1RS


If you do not hear back from us after two weeks, please assume on this occasion that unfortunately you have been

unsuccessful.

Agencies will be asked to work with us on this role if required. Speculative candidates submitted through agencies we have not instructed will not be considered to be represented by that agency.

checks is held in in accordance with all relevant data protection

regulations. Having a criminal record will not necessarily bar you from working with us. This will depend on the nature of the position and

the circumstances and background of your offences. At interview, or in a separate discussion, we ensure that an open and measured discussion takes place on the subject of any offences or other matter that

might be relevant to the position. Failure to reveal information that is directly relevant to the position sought could lead to withdrawal of an offer of employment. We make every subject of a DBS Disclosure

981145953a4ea96d.description:
The world leader in beauty, L’Oréal is present in 130 countries on five continents. Our 32 international brands have allowed us to devote ourselves solely to one business: beauty, with a mission to provide the best in cosmetics innovation to all women and men around the world. We want to bring beauty to all people. Our ambition by 2020 is to win over another one billion consumers around the world by creating the cosmetic products that meet the infinite diversity of their beauty needs and desires through continued digital innovation. L’Oréal encourages diversity and sustainable, ethical sourcing for all our products and we have reduced our emissions by approx. 50% since 2005. Our brands are leaders in beauty, and we are looking for you to lead the change you want to see in L’Oréal.
Consumer Products Division
The Consumer Products Division’s mission is universal: to offer the best in cosmetics innovation to the greatest number of people on every continent. Its brands are available in all mass-market channels (hypermarkets, supermarkets, pharmacy’s and retail stores). The division is the spearhead of the group’s quest to win over a further billion consumers. The Consumer Products Division includes popular brand such as L’Oréal Paris, NYX, Mixa, Garnier, Maybelline & Essie.
You will;
Assist the Communications team on L’Oreal Paris to let the media know what's going on; the latest innovations, products, trends and ingredients… showcasing that we are at the forefront of beauty as the worlds no1 beauty brand. Through traditional media, influencers, events and social media, you will seize every chance to tell the brands stories.
Key elements to your role:Your main accountability will be to provide support to the communications team, ensuring the smooth running of the press officeAssist with the development of all press office materials, including press releases, fact sheets, product launch recaps and presentationsOrder products and manage creative mailouts for new launchesManage couriers and book travelManage and update media lists; press and influencersRespond to journalists requests for product information and imageryMonitor newspapers, magazines and all social content for brand coverage and competitor activity, scanning all media relevant articles for distribution for teamsCompile monthly media coverage reports for wider audience/key stakeholders – designing presentation reports on PowerPointAssist with the organization of press and influencer trips and events. Eg Cannes Film Festival
 You are;
 Organised: You love a list and have strong planning and organisation skills – with the ability to re-prioritise as required. Measured: We want to track the success of our campaigns and initiatives so projects must be able to show ROI. Accurate: You have the ability to work to a high degree of accuracy and meet deadlines. Entrepreneurial. Every day, you spot opportunities to drive growth for our brand and our customers, making sure the good name of our brand is always protected. Super creative: Whether it be in overcoming challenges or creating artwork for your channel, creativity is our back bone, and we love new ideas. Proactive and Open: L’Oreal is for the pioneers, which means embracing new ideas, challenges and change with positivity and a hands on approach. Teams are the new heroes: There is no better feeling than being part of a successful and dynamic team, so even if you are Superman or Wonder Woman, you recognise that teams are the real heroes. Only Human: we all make mistakes, but you are not afraid of failure. You learn and show how the experience has helped the business learn for the future and benefitted all. Ambitious: You crave success and L’Oréal is the ultimate place to achieve your dreams. We will support you all the way and make sure you have the support and development in place to help you succeed. You. You are real. And you’re true to yourself. We cherish and celebrate diversity so you will feel right at home whoever you are.
You have;
 Ideally, you’ll have a minimum of 1 – 2 years’ experience working in PR/communications. The ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Strong UK media and influencer knowledge is essential but most importantly you’re passionate about beauty, communications and driven to land the brand message.
You show
Ambition: You anticipate, think and dream big, demonstrating a high level of aspiration. You are self-driven and show proactivity, especially when seeing problems as challenges. You thrive for exceptional performance.
Judgement: You can balance operational and strategic thinking, challenging the status quo and managing confrontation effectively. You cut quickly through complexity and ambiguity whilst also thinking sustainably and are future-oriented. You reduce complexity to get things done.
Resilience: You always demonstrate purpose and ownership mindset but manage your own energy well. You uphold positivity for others and persist, bouncing back when faced with obstacles. You step back at times and accept limits.
Empathy: You cooperate and network effectively, creating genuine and trustful relationships with diverse people. You are sensitive to beauty and related emotions, always supporting others and showing benevolence. You understand and respect others’ feelings and motives.
Learning Agility: You are a self-motivated learner, showing self-awareness and demonstrating openness and curiosity. You experiment and learn from mistakes and past experiences, always showing courage and stepping out of your comfort zone. You support the development of a learning culture.
You get
We put people development and learning at the heart of our business; we’ll help you master your role, develop your technical expertise and you’ll benefit from exceptional management and leadership programmes. From face-to-face workshops to our global online learning resources, you’re actively encouraged to embed learning into your daily life and are rewarded for continuous improvement. Don’t forget that every employee gets 3 Coursera credits; that means you can get qualifications from over 1000 universities from around the world, with thousands of courses to choose from.
Looking for a good work/life balance? With our new hybrid working scheme, you can take a flexible approach to work as well as benefit from early finishes on Fridays during the summer...so you can enjoy more time with your friends and family.
As any great employer should do, we make sure we look after your financial wellbeing. That’s why we have a great pension plan, profit share scheme and many more incentives to give you the security you deserve. We also put employee health and wellbeing at the front of everything we do; fully training employees as mental health ambassadors to support and educate ourselves further. There’s also the chance to enrol in medical and dental insurance, gym discounts, health check-ups and even yoga and Pilates classes to employees in all of our locations.
Oh, did we mention that as an employee you also get discount sales of up to 70% off throughout the year on our 36 brands? Plus, you also get the option to share that in our Friends and Family sales as well!
How we recruit
At L’Oréal, we take pride in creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment where everyone is welcome and their contributions are valued. When we recruit, hire, train, promote or engage in any other employment practice, we are committed to being an inclusive employer regardless of race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, socioeconomic status, medical condition or disability, or any other protected status. When we look for talent, we welcome difference - different backgrounds, experiences, personalities and perspectives. The beauty we find in our differences gives us the freedom to go beyond. That’s the beauty of L’Oréal.

f35b7e49c5fd2093.description:
The role
The Global Lounge is a physical space located in Senate House in the heart of campus. Previously operating in a pop-up mode, it celebrated its official launch at the end of 2021. It is a multifunctional hub open to all students and staff; hosting the University’s globally - oriented activities, promoting and celebrating multiculturalism on campus, and inspiring students to study and work abroad.

The Global Lounge has two main functions: to help with the integration of home and international students and to raise cultural awareness amongst all students and staff; and to support international students during their arrival and settling in period. Since its opening, hundreds of students have passed through its doors each week to attend welcome activities, receive practical support or guidance, and to study and relax. A number of cultural events - such as Day of the Dead, Diwali and Thanksgiving - have taken place, and the Global Lounge’s highly successful weekly Language Café attracts up to 200 students each week.

As the Global Lounge team and its reach is expanding, they are looking to start new social media channels and dedicate more resource to promotional activities. Together with the Officer, you will form part of a small Marketing sub-team; your role will encompass supporting all marketing and communications activities, promoting events and raising awareness of the Global Lounge, university-wide and beyond.
What will you be doing?
In this role, you will work closely with the Global Lounge Marketing and Communications Officer, supporting them with all marketing-related activities for the team.

Some of your daily tasks will include: helping to maintain the website and keeping listings up to date; liaising with central marketing teams to promote the Global Lounge via various channels; uploading events and managing booking systems.

You will assist the Officer with creating visual assets and other promotional marketing materials; this may include digital signage, social media graphics, PowerPoint slides, banners, merchandise, posters and flyers. You will create copy for Global Lounge-owned and external platforms, including websites, blogs, the student portal and newsletters, and will also help to maintain and develop content for their Vimeo channel.

The Global Lounge is preparing to launch brand-new social media accounts; this will offer you the fantastic opportunity of seeing a social media project through from its beginning stages to becoming an established channel, with involvement throughout the entire process.

As the Global Lounge events programme is versatile and wide-reaching, not only will you work within your own team, but with different faculties across the institution, and with central teams within the External Relations directorate (including International Marketing, Student Communications and Social Media). As part of the wider Global Lounge team, you may be involved in all aspects of organising and running a vast variety of wonderful and exciting cultural events.
You should apply if
You are full of ideas, have creative flair and can use an array of resources to create eye-catching, colourful and engaging content.
You are a skilled marketer and copywriter who is aware of the importance of house style, tone of voice and consistency, and can apply this to any content you produce.
You have a good eye for detail.
You have an active interest in, and passion for other cultures and can use this in a marketing and communications capacity.
You want to be part of a creative and ambitious team.
You are friendly and approachable with a can-do attitude, and ready for the exciting challenge of developing new content and platforms which support the University’s high-profile initiative

For informal queries please contact:

Ola Drummond ola.drummond@bristol.ac.uk (not available 4-14 February)
